skill.name: rdkit
skill.description: Cheminformatics toolkit for fine-grained molecular control. SMILES/SDF parsing, descriptors (MW, LogP, TPSA), fingerprints, substructure search, 2D/3D generation, similarity, reactions. For standard workflows with simpler interface, use datamol (wrapper around RDKit). Use rdkit for advanced control, custom sanitization, specialized algorithms.

security_audit.summary: This skill provides cheminformatics guidance and Python scripts for molecular analysis using RDKit. Scripts perform local file I/O and computational chemistry operations only. No network calls, credential access, environment harvesting, or code execution vulnerabilities were detected.

content.value_statement: You need reliable molecular analysis and filtering for small molecule datasets. This skill provides RDKit guidance and scripts for similarity search, descriptors, and substructure filters.
actual_capabilities: Calculate molecular properties including MW, LogP, TPSA, HBD, HBA, and QED drug-likeness scores.
Run fingerprint-based similarity search using Morgan, RDKit, MACCS, atom pair, or torsion methods.
Filter molecules by SMARTS patterns with include and exclude modes for substructure screening.
Export similarity hits and property tables to CSV for downstream analysis.
Read and write SDF, SMILES, and MOL files for batch molecular processing.
limitations: Requires RDKit installed in the Python environment via conda or pip.
Input and output files are limited to SDF, MOL, SMI, SMILES, or TXT formats.
Similarity search uses 2D fingerprints and does not perform 3D molecular alignment.
No built-in database indexing or distributed processing for very large libraries.

use_cases.title: Screen analogs by similarity
use_cases.description: Find close analogs of a query SMILES in an SDF or SMILES database using fingerprint similarity.

use_cases.title: Profile drug-likeness
use_cases.description: Generate key descriptors and Lipinski Rule of Five checks for a list of candidate molecules.

use_cases.title: Clean compound libraries
use_cases.description: Remove PAINS or reactive substructures from a screening library using SMARTS filters.

prompt_templates.title: Compute basic properties
prompt_templates.prompt: Calculate RDKit molecular properties for SMILES CCO and summarize MW, LogP, TPSA, HBD, HBA, and Lipinski pass.

prompt_templates.title: Batch properties to CSV
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the molecular properties script on molecules.smi and write results to properties.csv. Note any failed parses.

prompt_templates.title: Similarity search
prompt_templates.prompt: Run similarity search for query CCO against database.smi using Morgan radius 3, threshold 0.8, and output hits.csv.

prompt_templates.title: PAINS exclusion
prompt_templates.prompt: Filter compounds.smi to exclude the PAINS library, write clean.smi, and produce a CSV report of excluded matches.

output_examples.input: Calculate properties for SMILES CCO and summarize key results.

best_practices: Validate SMILES parsing and skip molecules that return None to avoid downstream errors.
Choose fingerprint type and similarity threshold based on your screening goal.
Save CSV outputs for traceability and integration with downstream analysis pipelines.
anti_patterns: Running similarity search with an invalid or empty query molecule.
Assuming 3D structural similarity from 2D fingerprints alone.
Using unsupported file formats without converting to SDF or SMILES first.

faq.question: Which Python environments are supported?
faq.answer: Any environment with RDKit installed, typically via conda install -c conda-forge rdkit or pip install rdkit-pypi.

faq.question: What are the size limits for input files?
faq.answer: No hard limits are coded, but very large libraries may be slow without database indexing.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into a pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Scripts accept file inputs and write CSV or SDF outputs suitable for chaining.

faq.question: Does this skill access my sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. The code performs only local file I/O for molecule files and makes no network calls.

faq.question: What if RDKit is not installed?
faq.answer: Install RDKit with conda or pip before running the scripts. Check the installation guide.

faq.question: How does this compare to datamol wrapper?
faq.answer: This skill uses direct RDKit APIs for fine-grained control, while datamol provides simpler high-level wrappers.
